alert.note: Alert for Boise (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 3:02PM MDT until further notice by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Idaho... Middle Fork Payette River Near Crouch affecting Boise County. For the Payette River...including Lowman, Crouch, Emmett, Payette... elevated river levels are forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 315 PM MDT. && ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Middle Fork Payette River Near Crouch. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.8 feet, Low-lying areas near the intersection of Banks-Lowman Road and Middle Fork Road will be impacted by floodwaters. Water will encroach on Weilmunster Park and the Garden Valley Trail. The river will be out of its banks and impact adjacent lowlands from Crouch upriver past Elk Springs Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 10.0 feet this evening. It will then rise to 11.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall to 10.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then rise to 11.5 feet Saturday morning. It will fall to 10.4 feet Friday, May 12 then rise again. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
